BY ADV. SRI.CIBI THOMAS RESPONDENT (S) /DEFACTO COMPLAINANT/STATE: 1. SAMEER K.K, S/O.MUHAMMED,AGED 41 YEARS ,KADAMKUNNUMMAL HOUSE, POOKOM, P.O.PANOOR, KANNUR DISTRICT-670673. 2. RESPONDENT'S EXHIBITS: NIL TRUE COPY PA TO JUDGE Scl. Bipasha] 2017/KER/49568 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. Dated this the 7" day of December, 2017 ORDER Petitioner is the second accused in Crime No.419/2015 of Chokli Police Station, which is now pending as C.C.No.666 of 2016 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Thalassery, registered for the offences punishable under Sections 448 and 427 r/w Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code. 2. It seems that the matter has been amicably settled between the parties. 3. On going through the facts and circumstances of the case, it seems that the matter can be permitted to be settled. 4. It has been reported that no criminal antecedents have been reported against the petitioner. The first respondent has filed Annexure-III affidavit affirming that the matter has been amicably settled between him and the petitioner and he has no complaints against the petitioner. Considering the fact that the matter has already been settled amicably between the El apa 2017/KER/49568 Cril.M.C. No.8166 of 2017 -2- parties, this court is satisfied that no purpose would be served in proceeding with the trial of the case. Matters being so, all further proceedings in C.C.No.666 of 2016 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Thalassery, in Crime No.419/2015 of Chokli Police Station, against the petitioner, are liable to be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and all further proceedings in C.C.No.666 of 2016 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Thalassery, in Crime No.419/2015 of Chokli Police Station, against the petitioner, against the petitioner, are hereby quashed. Sd/- B.KEMAL PASHA JUDGE Scl/07.12.2017
